intro: Blairia nodiflora, commonly known as the clustered blairia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually small and yellow or white, arranged in clusters along the stems. Blairia nodiflora is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
